net.tridentsdk.concurrent

Class ScheduledRunnable

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tridentsdk.concurrent.ScheduledRunnable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class ScheduledRunnable
extends Object
implements Runnable
    A wrapper over Runnable that provides access to the scheduling facilities after scheduled
    Since:
    0.3-alpha-DP
    Author:
    The TridentSDK Team

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ScheduledRunnable() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterAsyncRun()
      Runs after this runnable has finished asynchronously
      void afterSyncRun()
      Runs after this runnable has been executed synchronously
      ScheduledTask asScheduledTask()
      The scheduled representation of the runnable
      void beforeRun()
      Guaranteed to be run before this Runnable on the main thread, even if this runnable is going to be run asynchronously, useful for collecting resources to work on.
      void cancel()
      Cancels the task and removes from execution.
      int id()
      Used internally to refer to this runnable, probably shouldn't be used by plugins
      long interval()
      Gets how long between runs this is supposed to wait if it is a repeating task
      void markSchedule(ScheduledTask task) 
      void setInterval(long interval)
      Sets how long this runnable should wait between executions if this is a repeating task

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Runnable

        run

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScheduledRunnable

        public ScheduledRunnable()

    • Method Detail

      • beforeRun

        public void beforeRun()
        Guaranteed to be run before this Runnable on the main thread, even if this runnable is going to be run asynchronously, useful for collecting resources to work on.

        This method is invoked synchronously relative to the Runnable.run() method

      • afterAsyncRun

        public void afterAsyncRun()
        Runs after this runnable has finished asynchronously

        This method does not require the code to be thread-safe

      • afterSyncRun

        public void afterSyncRun()
        Runs after this runnable has been executed synchronously

      • cancel

        public final void cancel()
        Cancels the task and removes from execution. See ScheduledTask.cancel()

        WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when task() != null.

      • interval

        public final long interval()
        Gets how long between runs this is supposed to wait if it is a repeating task

        WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when task() != null.

      • setInterval

        public final void setInterval(long interval)
        Sets how long this runnable should wait between executions if this is a repeating task

        If this task is synchronous to the main thread, the change will be immediate, if it is not, the change may take an iteration to take effect, however interval() will reflect the changes immediately

        WARNING: This is a delegated function. DO NOT call this method before it is scheduled. A NullPointerException will be thrown. This can be called when task() != null.

      • id

        public final int id()
        Used internally to refer to this runnable, probably shouldn't be used by plugins

      • asScheduledTask

        public ScheduledTask asScheduledTask()
        The scheduled representation of the runnable
        Returns:
        the ScheduledTask object held within the scheduling implementation

      • markSchedule

        @InternalUseOnly
public void markSchedule(ScheduledTask task)
